Ingredients.4: 2 small stalks celery from the heart, minced

Ingredients.5: 2 drops green food coloring, or as desired

Directions.1: Place eggs in a saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil, remove from heat, and let eggs stand in the hot water for 15 minutes. Remove from hot water and chill at least 30 minutes in a bowl of cold water or in the refrigerator, until eggs are cold.

Directions.2: Prepare egg dye according to package directions in a large metal or glass bowl.

Directions.3: Gently crack eggs but do not remove shells so that the egg dye can reach the egg whites.

Directions.4: Place the cracked hard-cooked eggs into the dye, working in batches if necessary, until dye seeps through the cracks and colors the eggs slightly, about 5 minutes per batch.

Directions.5: Rinse eggs and peel to expose the green marbled color; slice eggs in half lengthwise.

Directions.6: Scoop egg yolks into a bowl and mash with a fork and mix in the mayonnaise and celery; stir green food coloring into the yolk mixture.

Directions.7: Spoon the yolk mixture into the egg halves; top each egg half with a parsley leaf.
